name: Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley

reviews.text: We (two adults, two children) stayed for five nights, two of which the hotel appeared full. One bedroom suite was a decent size and beds were very comfortable. Everything was clean and in good shape. We never heard any of the neighbors and in spite of being across from an elevator it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was great, and there were plenty of tables. Staff was friendly and especially helpful with directions. You will need a car at this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent.....
Nice place - great waffles!
reviews.text: Location is good, very close to Zoo, Sea World, airport and Old Town. Large mall with restaurants is nearby, just off Hotel Circle north, easy to get to.

reviews.title: Very Clean and Nice!
reviews.text: Hotel parking is an extra $6. charge, which seems unnecessary and was annoying. Parking spaces seem particularly narrow, you need to be careful how you park. Computers & printer available for a modest fee.
Very odd building layout - you have to go outside to get to the lobby, and only certain elevators go to the first floor.
reviews.title: Not impressed but maybe just not for us?

reviews.text: We checked into this hotel because we were fleeing the Holiday Inn nearby. Boy, what a difference! We chose the 2 bedroom Kid's Suite because we were travelling with 2 young boys. They loved the bunk beds, the private room and the TV all to themselves. My husband and loved the nice living room, clean kitchen, and comfortable king-sized bed in a private bedroom. (The Holiday Inn had the beds all sharing the same room.) The property in general is very lovely and the staff are extremely helpful and nice. And even though they are located right by the freeway, the rooms were quiet and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very nice
A Pleasant Stay
reviews.text: The breakfast is included in the price of the room, but to be honest, it was just okay food. We had a much better meal at the coffee house just down the street. The second thing that would keep me from rating this property "excellent" is the parking fee of $6 every night. There was really no need to do this since there were other hotels all up and down the street and there was no way someone would want to park in their lot unless they were staying here. And last, the size of the master bedroom width-wise was barely big enough for the bed and dresser. When I had to get up in the middle of the night, my husband's feet and the blankets were right up next to the dresser and I nearly tripped trying to walk by. That was a bummer. The good night's rest made up for it, though.

reviews.title: We will be back as soon as possible
reviews.text: Our family of six stayed for five nights during spring break. It felt like a home away from home. The breakfast was wonderful (make your own waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, yogurt, granola, I could go on and on). The was just enough seating during the very busy times with the tables in and out. It is a beautiful hotel with great customer service. They will even pick up groceries for you for free! We stayed in a Two bedroom kid's suite. It was very roomy and quiet, three tv's, a kitchen & a living room. The only thing odd about the room was the bathroom was located through the Parent's bedroom (we had an infant that would nap in there and was disturbed anytime someone needed to use the restroom). I think our kids looked forward to returning to the hotel every evening just as much as the attractions we were visiting. There were many other friendly families there, all the kids played together. We participated in the evening reception on our last night and wished we had discovered it sooner. We had lasagna and salad and drinks (red & white wine, and a microbrew on tap). It was so wonderful not to have to head back out in the evening to find some food, we got to swim, relax, eat, and swim some more. They also have bar-b-que's available for anyone to use. I am excited to go back just to stay at this hotel. Everything was so clean, well cared for and simply beautiful!!!!

reviews.title: Our Favorite Hotel ever!
reviews.text: We have stayed at this establishment twice. Both times it was excellent. Very modern updated decor. Computer available with internet for free in the lobby - great for a quick check up on things. Helpful desk staff who will draw maps how to get to places. Super-duper free breakfast each morning with waffles, cereal, yogurt, fresh fruit, pastry, hot dishes. Managers "snack" at night were things like pizza, pasta night, nachos, and always a salad and soft drinks available. Awesome rooms - large, comfy and clean. Very quiet. Great location easily accessible to all the local attractions. We will stay here the next time we are through San Diego!

reviews.title: You sometimes get more than you pay for :)
reviews.text: What a Hotel. Kids suites are a little pricy ($$) But well worth it. Two bedrooms. VERY NICE. Staff is extreemly friendly. Front desk has maps. Their maps show you return directions as well. Very helpful!! If they don't have if they will find it. Breakfast was wonderful!! Not your average donuts and coffee. Full breakfast. ( I had biscuits and gravy everyday for a week) The weekly manager reception is ok. Go early. Pool area very clean, game room small but all the games worked. Great exercise room. It gets a little busy, but is open 24 hours. If you ask the house keeping staff will clean around your schedule. They came at different times through out the day.

reviews.title: Nice family hotel
reviews.text: Parking gets a little scarce around 2 or 3 pm. Plenty of parking in back.

Stayed for a week, could have stayed longer. Sea World and Zoo great fun. Buy the year lond pass at Sea World, go back as many times as you want. (Hard to see all shows and animals in one day) Allow at least 2 days for each. We traveled with a 9 and 11 year old. Take lots of breaks. If you have extra time, check out the Scripps Aquariam. great view of the ocean and surfers. Go early, field trips came in around 10am. Lunch not great :( Eat off site. Have Fun.
reviews.title: Great location and amenities

reviews.text: I'm always a little worried when I book a hotel that has tons and tons of great reviews. I have this image in my head of somebody at the hotel getting paid to sit at a computer and write reviews all day long! We've been bitterly dissapointed in the past. That was so NOT the case at the Marriott Residence Inn.
reviews.title: all the great reviews were true!

reviews.text: We showed up about 6 hours before check-in time hoping they might have a room for us and they did. The free breakfast was great and they did a super job of keeping things clean even with a lot of little kids running around. Because there were a lot of people there for long stays, everybody seemed to treat the community areas more like they would their own homes and tended to pick up after themselves which helped too.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: My kids loved playing pool and pingpong in the gameroom. They also made good use of the basketball court and the pool. The laundry room came in handy too! The staff was super nice to us and the kids. They had tons of sheets of good directions handy to area attractions. When it was time to check out, they even printed out a mapquest route to our next hotel!
reviews.title: Great Staff and Great Room
Darn Near Perfect
reviews.text: Our kids' suite room was a very comfortable set up. The bunkbed idea is great. I don't know why more hotels don't do that! It was also great that they had a full compliment of dishes (and a dishwasher so I didn't have to handwash!!). They only thing I'd change would be to add an additional entry to the bathroom or another bathroom so the kids didn't have to walk through the masterbedroom to go potty. We got woken up a lot by the toilet flushing.

All in all, we thought we got a great value and although this hotel didn't have a view of anything other than a freeway, it was very centrally located to everything we wanted to do. We'd definitely return.
reviews.title: Just Fantastic!

aka: Residence Inn San Diego Mission Valley Hotel San Diego
description: The Residence Inn by Marriott® San Diego Mission Valley is in the center of it all! We are an upscale all suite extended stay hotel in San Diego California located only five miles from the San Diego International Airport (SAN) and just down the street from Sea World Adventure Park®. From the beaches of Torrey Pines to Belmont and Balboa Parks to the night life of the Downtown Gaslamp Quarter, The Residence Inn by Marriott® San Diego MissionValley is in the heart of all San Diego!
